basics.name: Haonan Feng
basics.label: AI Security, AI for Security, Formal Verification
basics.summary: PhD student at the School of Cyberspace Security, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, engaged in research related to AI security and formal verification.

education.institution: School of Cyberspace Security, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications
School of Cyberspace Security, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications
School of Cyberspace Security, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications

work.name: Ant Group
work.summary: Engaged in cryptographic LLM, Federated Learning, Secure Multi-Party Computation, etc.

publications.name: A Formal Analysis of the FIDO UAF Protocol
publications.publisher: Haonan Feng, Hui Li, Xuesong Pan, Ziming Zhao
publications.summary: Conducted formal analysis of the FIDO UAF protocol; proposed a new verification method, developed an open-source automated verification tools (UAFVerif); published 2 papers (NDSS/TDSC); reported a CNNVD vulnerability.

publications.name: FIDO gets verified: A formal analysis of the universal authentication framework protocol
publications.publisher: Haonan Feng, Jingjing Guan, Hui Li, Xuesong Pan, Ziming Zhao
publications.summary: The FIDO UAF protocol is further analyzed using the proposed minimal assumption verification method, and a complete analysis method and analysis conclusion are proposed.

publications.name: Authenticator rebinding attack of the UAF protocol on mobile devices
publications.publisher: Hui Li, Xuesong Pan, Xinluo Wang, Haonan Feng
publications.summary: The paper proposed an authenticator rebinding attack on the FIDO UAF protocol, verified it in practice on an actual APP, and published related vulnerabilities.

awards.title: Special Prize in the 4th National Cartographic Technology Competition
awards.summary: Design a Windows system login system that supports secure collaboration on mobile phones, realizing a security assistance system that “unlocks when a person arrives and locks when a person leaves,” and successfully apply for a patent.

awards.title: First Prize in the College Student Innovation and Entrepreneurship Practice
awards.awarder: Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications
awards.summary: Design and implement a cross-platform, secure password management system that supports multi-factor authentication.

awards.title: Second Prize in the 10th National College Student Information Security Competition
awards.awarder: China Ministry of Education Higher Education Cyberspace Security Professional Teaching Steering Committee
awards.summary: Design and implement a cross-platform, secure password management system that supports multi-factor authentication.

awards.title: National Scholarship
awards.awarder: Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications

certificates.name: Trusted-Environment-based Cryptographic Computing system (TECC)
